message.content:
The most likely category for this paper is "Books" because it is discussing a specific book, "Sundiata: An Epic of Old Mali." 

The second likely category is "Arts, Crafts & Sewing" because the book is a work of literature and storytelling, which falls under the arts category. 

The third likely category is "History" because the book is a historical epic that tells the story of Sundiata, a legendary figure in Malian history. 

The fourth likely category is "African Literature" because the book is a translation of an African oral tradition into written form. 

The fifth likely category is "Cultural Studies" because the book explores the cultural heritage and traditions of Mali through the storytelling of griots.

prompt:
Title: Sundiata: An Epic of Old Mali (Revised Edition) (Longman African Writers)
Content: Born in Guinea, author and playwright Djibril Tamsir Niane is a descendant of griots – African oral historians/storytellers.  He translated Sundiata, as told by the griot Djeli Mamadou Kouyate, into French under the titleSoundjata ou Epoque Mandiginuein 1960.  It was later translated into English by G. D. Pickett in 1965....
